alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 09 at 11:53PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Bryce Canyon Country, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, slickrock areas, and other low-lying flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood The Flood Watch will expire for a portion of Utah, including the following areas, Bryce Canyon Country, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. The flooding threat has ended. Therefore, the Flood Watch will expire at Midnight MDT tonight.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Zion National Park
